<small>Also see: [[H2954]]</small>

 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רֻטֲפַשׁ‎</span> **verb quadriliteral intransitive** ==grow fresh== ([[BDB#Ges|Ges]]<sup>«GKC:56»§ 56</sup>; si vera lectio, transposed <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎טרפשׁ‎</span> [expanded from <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎טָפַשׁ‎</span> ***be wide, loose, delicate***, compare especially Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***tapâšu***</u></abbr>, ***be fat***, [[BDB#Zim|Zim]]<sup>BP 99 A</sup> [[BDB#Frä|Frä]]<sup>ZA iii. 55</sup>], compare Talmud <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎טַרְפְּשָׁא‎</span> ***fatty membrane***, Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> [[BDB#PS|PS]]<sup>1527</sup> ***thin flesh***; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***be convalescent***; but <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ר‎</span> perhaps not original); — ***Perfect*** passive <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רֻטֲפַשׁ בְּשָׂרוֺ מִנֹּעַר‎</span> [[Job.33.25|Job 33:25]] ***his flesh hath grown fresher than***, etc.; read perhaps <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎טפשׁ‎</span> Altschüller<sup>ZAW vi (1886), 212</sup>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יטפשׁ‎</span> [[BDB#Bi|Bi]] [[BDB#Bu|Bu]] compare [[BDB#Du|Du]].
